data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبِّهِمْ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
The word مَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
data.sentence: The word يَأْتِيهِمْ comes from the root ا ت ي and is associated with the meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake

data.meanings: played/sported/gamed/jested/joked, passtime (in an unserious thing), engage in idle sport without meaning or purpose, slaver/drivel, stupid/fool.
data.sentence: The word يَلْعَبُونَ comes from the root ل ع ب and is associated with the meanings: played/sported/gamed/jested/joked, passtime (in an unserious thing), engage in idle sport without meaning or purpose, slaver/drivel, stupid/fool.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word ذِكْرٍ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: something new/recent, it (a thing) came into existence, began to be, originated, had a beginning, existed newly for the first time, to relate discourse,story/report/narration/statement/tale.Lane: "hadathu - a novelty or new thing, an innovation, a thing not known before, and particularly relating to El-Islam (i.e. to matters of religious doctrines or practices or the like)"
data.sentence: The word مُحْدَثٍ comes from the root ح د ث and is associated with the meanings: something new/recent, it (a thing) came into existence, began to be, originated, had a beginning, existed newly for the first time, to relate discourse,story/report/narration/statement/tale.Lane: "hadathu - a novelty or new thing, an innovation, a thing not known before, and particularly relating to El-Islam (i.e. to matters of religious doctrines or practices or the like)"
The word اسْتَمَعُوهُ comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.
